intro: Phacelia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable phacelia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from lobed to linear. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Phacelia heterophylla is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators and its use in ecological restoration projects.
